meanings.definition: An act of giving up something valued for the sake of something else regarded as more important or worthy.
meanings.sent1: Her sacrifice of dessert to help her friend showed her kindness.
meanings.sent2: The soldier made a sacrifice by leaving his family to protect his country.
meanings.sent3: The sacrifice of his favorite toy for a new one made his little brother very happy.
meanings.sent4: The sacrifice of sleep for studying paid off with good grades.
meanings.sent5: The sacrifice of time spent playing for time spent reading made her a better student.

meanings.definition: To give up something for the sake of other considerations.
meanings.sent1: She had to sacrifice her free time to finish the project on time.
meanings.sent2: He decided to sacrifice his vacation to help his colleagues with the workload.
meanings.sent3: I will sacrifice my favorite TV show to go for a run instead.
meanings.sent4: They sacrificed their comfort to support a friend in need.
meanings.sent5: The team sacrificed their day off to prepare for the upcoming competition.

meanings.definition: To offer or kill as a religious sacrifice.
meanings.sent1: In ancient times, people would sacrifice animals to please the gods.
meanings.sent2: The priest would sacrifice a lamb during the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would sacrifice his alarm clock to never wake up early again.
meanings.sent4: The coach asked the players to sacrifice their egos for the success of the team.
meanings.sent5: The tradition was to sacrifice a portion of the harvest to ensure a good yield next season.
